summary: This is an email from a USMS Associate General Counsel to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding FOIA disclosures and a Touhy request from the Government of the United States Virgin Islands (GVI) concerning Jeffrey Epstein. It informs the recipient of prior FOIA releases and coordinates a response to the GVI's request for information for potential use in a civil matter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of FOIA and Touhy requests
persons.context: The deceased individual whose records are being sought by the Government of the United States Virgin Islands (GVI) via a Touhy request for potential use in a civil matter.

persons.name: Associate General Counsel USMS/HQ/OGC
persons.role: Associate General Counsel for the US Marshals Service
persons.context: The author of the email, coordinating FOIA disclosures and the response to the GVI's Touhy request regarding Jeffrey Epstein with the US Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Civil Chief of the USAO/GVI
persons.role: Civil Chief for the US Attorney's Office for the US Virgin Islands
persons.context: The individual to whom the Touhy request from the GVI was forwarded; will be the point of contact for crafting the USMS response.

connections.description: The Associate General Counsel forwarded the Touhy request to the Civil Chief and will serve as the USMS point of contact in crafting a coordinated response.
The Associate General Counsel is handling FOIA disclosures and a Touhy request concerning information about Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FOIA Disclosure to USANYS
events.description: The US Marshals Service (USMS) released material in response to a FOIA request and informed the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) about it.

events.title: Touhy Request from GVI
events.description: The Government of the United States Virgin Islands (GVI) submitted a Touhy request to the Office of Justice Programs and the USDOJ SMART Office seeking information about Jeffrey Epstein for potential use in a civil matter.

keyFacts: The US Marshals Service (USMS) had previously released material about Jeffrey Epstein in response to a FOIA request in September 2019.
The Government of the United States Virgin Islands (GVI) submitted a Touhy request in April 2020 seeking information about Jeffrey Epstein for potential use in a civil matter.
The USMS is coordinating its response to the GVI's Touhy request with the Civil Chief of the US Attorney's Office for the US Virgin Islands (USAO/GVI).

The email suggests the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) may be involved in matters related to Jeffrey Epstein or his estate that could be impacted by the release of this information.
